Output of `helm version`:
```
Client: &version.Version{SemVer:“v2.8.2”, GitCommit:“a80231648a1473929271764b920a8e346f6de844", GitTreeState:“clean”}
Server: &version.Version{SemVer:“v2.8.2", GitCommit:“a80231648a1473929271764b920a8e346f6de844”, GitTreeState:“clean”}
```

Output of `kubectl version`:

Cloud Provider/Platform (AKS, GKE, Minikube etc.): AKS

# Description

Whilst investigating #3675 I noticed that a failed rollback is left in the `PENDING_ROLLBACK` state (see #3675 for repro steps):

```
$ ~/go/src/k8s.io/helm/bin/helm history test
REVISION	UPDATED                 	STATUS          	CHART     	DESCRIPTION     
1       	Thu Mar 15 10:21:51 2018	SUPERSEDED      	test-0.1.0	Install complete
2       	Thu Mar 15 10:23:52 2018	SUPERSEDED      	test-0.1.0	Upgrade complete
3       	Thu Mar 15 10:25:14 2018	PENDING_ROLLBACK	test-0.1.0	Rollback to 1   
```

Also, the tiller logs show:

```
[tiller] 2018/03/15 10:25:15 warning: Failed to record release test: release: "test.v3" already exists
```
In the [error handling](https://github.com/kubernetes/helm/blob/3ba2a0098241f0513c7d8d5e23fea6d67a4168c5/pkg/tiller/release_rollback.go#L138) in `performRollback` it passes `false` to the `recordRelease` function. Looking at [the code](https://github.com/kubernetes/helm/blob/3ba2a0098241f0513c7d8d5e23fea6d67a4168c5/pkg/tiller/release_server.go#L320) for `recordRelease` the boolean parameter is `reuse`, i.e. `true` to update an existing record and `false` to create a new record. In `prepareRollback` it [creates a new release](https://github.com/kubernetes/helm/blob/3ba2a0098241f0513c7d8d5e23fea6d67a4168c5/pkg/tiller/release_rollback.go#L62), so the error handling in `performRollback` needs updating to update the record created in `prepareRollback`.


Addressing this doesn't fix #3675, but it does at least mark the rollback as failing as per the intention of the code (and remove the error from the tiller logs).
title: Failed rollback left in PENDING_ROLLBACK state
